FuncDef:
The source-ip command configures a source IPv4 address listened during Telemetry dynamic subscription.
The undo source-ip command deletes a source IPv4 address listened during Telemetry dynamic subscription.
By default, no source IPv4 address is configured for Telemetry dynamic subscription.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a source IPv4 address to be listened.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies the name of a VPN instance to be bound to the source IPv4 address to be listened.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.
The value must be the name of an existing VPN instance.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
If a collector functioning as a client initiates a connection to a device functioning as a server, the data sampled is dynamically subscribed to. In this case, on the server, configure a source IPv4 address to be listened. A connection can then be established between the server and client.
Precautions
To ensure that routes are reachable between the server and client, you can set the source IP address on the server to 0.0.0.0. In this case, the client can certainly establish a connection with the server. If you do not set the source IPv4 address to 0.0.0.0, ensure that it is an existing service interface IP address. In this case, the client establishes a connection with the server based on the source IPv4 address configured.
To delete a configured source IPv4 address in the gRPC server view, ensure that the gRPC service is disabled.
